We are seeking an experienced Sr. Data Scientist to develop innovative methods for analyzing unstructured data, providing insights and solutions for enhancing client services and products.

Primary Responsibilities:

Synthesize business rules and methodological approach with minimal supervision to address questions posed by internal or external business partners
Analyze raw data from multiple sources, such as sales, inventory, and claims data, using algorithms and statistical programming
Ensure data sets and reports are built to specifications and format output for customer readiness
Facilitate and participate in peer review meetings for each deliverable
Leverage data visualization and interactive dashboards to communicate insights effectively and help stakeholders make informed decisions using McKesson data products
Interact with business partners to assess needs and review results
Translate findings from reports into implications or recommendations for business decisions
Formulate and implement effective data strategies and identify areas for significant efficiency gains through automation
Provide quality assurance on all assigned reporting and data extracts

Minimum Requirements:

Typically requires 7+ years of relevant experience.

Education:

Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience. Master's or Ph.D. is preferred.

Critical Skills

7+ years of work experience in data analysis and/or supporting healthcare information systems
7+ years of programming experience in Python/R
Proficient in SQL and other databases such as Databricks, Snowflake, HANA, etc.
Proficient in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau.
Experience in statistical programming, data analysis, visualization, and applying quantitative methods to real-world business problems in the healthcare industry
Experience in mining big data, preferably healthcare-related data
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

Additional Skills:

Comfortable with a fast-paced, high-performance environment.
Ambitious, flexible, team player.
Outstanding communication skills, with both the internal team and clients.
